choke.comment: 59 = ride rim, 51 = ride, 55 = crash rim, 49 = crash; see the choke.py code comments for further explanations of the configuration options.

exec.comment: A simple test spawning gnome-calculator on MIDI note 51. See the exec.py code comments for further explanations of the configuration options.

replace.comment: 49 = crash bow, 51 = ride bow, 38 = snare, 45 = mid tom
55 = crash rim, 59 = ride rim, 38 = snare, 45 = mid tom

On [enable] MIDI notes (may be empty), replace all incoming MIDI notes matching [from] to the MIDI note [to]. If [enabled] is true, do not wait for the [enable] notes to occur, but directly replace all incoming [from] notes with [to] right from the start. On [disable] MIDI notes, disable the replacement again. If a note is included in both [enable] and [disable], it will toggle the replacement. [port] specifies the port on which to run a TCP server to provide an unsecured API to enable the replacement. It can be switched off by setting [server] to false. Its interface can be set via [address] (default: localhost). netcat or other programs can be used to bind replacements to hotkeys via this API. Available API commands: enable|disable|toggle|unique [id]|next|previous. See the replace.py code comments for further details.
